results.title: ‘The Ring’ at 20: Millennial Horror That’s Still Infecting Movies Today
results.abstract: The film that kicked off the West’s J-horror fascination was made in the shadow of 9/11. Its influence can be seen in “Smile,” “It Follows” and more.

multimedia.caption: Naomi Watts played a journalist who tracks down the deadly video. At the time, she was a relative unknown.
Naomi Watts played a journalist who tracks down the deadly video. At the time, she was a relative unknown.
Naomi Watts played a journalist who tracks down the deadly video. At the time, she was a relative unknown.

results.title: ‘The School for Good and Evil’ Review: Ever Afters and Never Afters
results.abstract: Two best friends have princess dreams and witchy nightmares in this adaptation of Soman Chainani’s book series.
des_facet: The School for Good and Evil (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Sophia Anne Caruso, left, and Sofia Wylie in “The School for Good and Evil.”
Sophia Anne Caruso, left, and Sofia Wylie in “The School for Good and Evil.”
Sophia Anne Caruso, left, and Sofia Wylie in “The School for Good and Evil.”

results.title: Dwayne Johnson Is Ready to Embrace the Heel Again in ‘Black Adam’
results.abstract: In his wrestling days, he played the baddie. Now the action star is known for good-guy roles. He explains why he pushed so hard to play the DC antihero.

multimedia.caption: Dwayne Johnson wasn’t bothered by Black Adam’s scoundrel status: “What’s critical is the investment in more superhero characters of color, and Black Adam is one of them.”
multimedia.copyright: Ricardo Nagaoka for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Dwayne Johnson wasn’t bothered by Black Adam’s scoundrel status: “What’s critical is the investment in more superhero characters of color, and Black Adam is one of them.”

results.title: ‘Definition Please,’ ‘Cyrus’ and More Streaming Gems
results.abstract: This month’s under-the-radar picks from your streaming subscription services include a trio of emotional family dramedies, an again-timely campaign documentary and a pair of taut suspense movies.

multimedia.caption: Sujata Day, left, and Ritesh Rajan in “Definition Please,” a film written and directed by Day.
Sujata Day, left, and Ritesh Rajan in “Definition Please,” a film written and directed by Day.
Sujata Day, left, and Ritesh Rajan in “Definition Please,” a film written and directed by Day.

results.title: How ‘Triangle of Sadness’ Turns the Tables of Status
results.abstract: The writer and director Ruben Ostlund narrates a pivotal scene from his satire.

results.title: ‘Year One: A Political Odyssey’ Review: Biden by the Numbers
results.abstract: Despite the insider access, a documentary about the president’s first year in office is short on intriguing tidbits.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “Year One: A Political Odyssey.” The HBO documentary offers a selective overview of President Biden’s first 365-plus days in office.
A scene from “Year One: A Political Odyssey.” The HBO documentary offers a selective overview of President Biden’s first 365-plus days in office.
A scene from “Year One: A Political Odyssey.” The HBO documentary offers a selective overview of President Biden’s first 365-plus days in office.

results.title: Robert De Niro’s Career in Five Artifacts
results.abstract: The actor recently donated hundreds of boxes of scripts, props, notes and other objects from his work on “Raging Bull,” “Taxi Driver” and more. We dived in.

multimedia.caption: Robert De Niro in a scene from “Taxi Driver.” The license he obtained to work as a cabby is part of his donated archives.
Robert De Niro in a scene from “Taxi Driver.” The license he obtained to work as a cabby is part of his donated archives.
Robert De Niro in a scene from “Taxi Driver.” The license he obtained to work as a cabby is part of his donated archives.

results.title: Netflix Adds 2.4 Million Subscribers, Reversing a Decline
results.abstract: Netflix, which has about 223 million subscribers worldwide, will soon introduce a lower-priced service with ads in a bid to attract more customers.

multimedia.caption: “After a challenging first half, we believe we’re on a path to re-accelerate growth,” Netflix said in its quarterly letter to shareholders. “The key is pleasing members.”
“After a challenging first half, we believe we’re on a path to re-accelerate growth,” Netflix said in its quarterly letter to shareholders. “The key is pleasing members.”
“After a challenging first half, we believe we’re on a path to re-accelerate growth,” Netflix said in its quarterly letter to shareholders. “The key is pleasing members.”

results.title: Under the Skin of Jamie Lee Curtis
results.abstract: Whether it’s her return to her horror roots in “Halloween Ends” or her buzzy performance in “Everything Everywhere All at Once,” freedom is what the actress is after.

multimedia.caption: “I feel all the feels, all the time,” Jamie Lee Curtis said.
multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

results.abstract: A daughter’s memory of a vacation in Turkey is at the heart of Charlotte Wells’s astonishing and devastating debut feature.

results.abstract: The long-running horror anthology has a new installment.

results.title: ‘Raymond & Ray’ Review: Oh, Brother
results.abstract: Ewan McGregor and Ethan Hawke struggle to dig themselves out of this dreary drama about damaged siblings reckoning with their father’s death.

results.title: ‘Brainwashed: Sex-Camera-Power’ Review: Demystifying the Male Gaze
results.abstract: Directed by Nina Menkes, the film is a distressingly prescriptive documentary aimed at unpacking the patriarchal ways of seeing that have dominated the history of cinema.

multimedia.caption: The director Nina Menkes in the documentary “Brainwashed: Sex-Camera-Power.”
The director Nina Menkes in the documentary “Brainwashed: Sex-Camera-Power.”
The director Nina Menkes in the documentary “Brainwashed: Sex-Camera-Power.”

results.title: Quintessa Swindell Smashes Barriers in DC’s ‘Black Adam’
results.abstract: “My trans and nonbinary identity is the thing that I’m the most confident about in my life,” Mx. Swindell said.

results.title: Luke Parker Bowles, the Queen Consort’s Nephew, on Life in New Jersey
results.abstract: The film and television producer, who works with the British Consulate, is also committed to saving small-town movie theaters in the United States.

multimedia.caption: Luke Parker Bowles, above, at the Village at Sopac in South Orange, N.J. The movie theater is one of several that he has taken over and refurbished with the actor Patrick Wilson.
multimedia.copyright: Janice Chung for The New York Times

results.title: Review: In This ‘Wuthering Heights,’ Music, Moors and Untamed Spirits
results.abstract: Emma Rice’s glorious stage adaptation of Emily Brontë’s novel is a feat of storytelling, with a singing and dancing chorus embodying the moors.

multimedia.caption: Lucy McCormick as Catherine, wild thing of Wuthering Heights, in Emma Rice’s production at St. Ann’s Warehouse in Brooklyn.
Lucy McCormick as Catherine, wild thing of Wuthering Heights, in Emma Rice’s production at St. Ann’s Warehouse in Brooklyn.

results.title: ‘Mama’s Boy’ Review: Mother and Son Pave the Way Forward
results.abstract: In this documentary, the Oscar-winning screenwriter Dustin Lance Black looks at how his relationship with his mother motivated his L.G.B.T.Q. activism.

results.title: Robbie Coltrane, Hagrid in the ‘Harry Potter’ Films, Dies at 72
results.abstract: The veteran Scottish actor and comedian also won acclaim for playing a gambling-addicted psychologist on the crime series “Cracker” in the 1990s.
results.byline: By Amanda Holpuch and Alex Marshall

results.abstract: Halloween is around the corner, which means the annual scary film dump-a-thon is on. But don’t fear: These frightening treats will do the trick.

results.title: ‘The Curse of Bridge Hollow’ Review: Attack of the Halloween Décor
results.abstract: A father and daughter team up to save a town after she sets loose a spirit that brings spooky decorations to life.

results.title: ‘The Piano Lesson’ Review: August Wilson’s Phantom Notes
results.abstract: John David Washington, Danielle Brooks and Samuel L. Jackson star in the first Broadway revival of Wilson’s haunting family drama set in 1936.

results.title: ‘Halloween Ends’ Review: It Probably Doesn’t
results.abstract: David Gordon Green wraps up his reboot trilogy for a horror franchise that never stays dead for long.

multimedia.caption: Still a scream: Jamie Lee Curtis as Laurie Strode in “Halloween Ends.”
Still a scream: Jamie Lee Curtis as Laurie Strode in “Halloween Ends.”

results.title: ‘Decision to Leave’ Review: A Labyrinth of Desire
results.abstract: Park Chan-wook’s latest, about a forlorn detective falling for his beautiful suspect, is an exuberant, destabilizing take on a classic film noir setup.

multimedia.caption: Park Hae-il, left, and Tang Wei in the enjoyably dizzying Korean mystery “Decision to Leave.”
Park Hae-il, left, and Tang Wei in the enjoyably dizzying Korean mystery “Decision to Leave.”
Park Hae-il, left, and Tang Wei in the enjoyably dizzying Korean mystery “Decision to Leave.”

results.title: ‘Till’ Review: He Was Someone’s Son, Too
results.abstract: Chinonye Chukwu’s new film reminds us that before his gruesome murder galvanized a civil rights movement, Emmett Till was a 14-year-old boy with a doting mother.

multimedia.caption: Jalyn Hall as Emmett Till and Danielle Deadwyler as his mother, Mamie, in “Till.”
Jalyn Hall as Emmett Till and Danielle Deadwyler as his mother, Mamie, in “Till.”
Jalyn Hall as Emmett Till and Danielle Deadwyler as his mother, Mamie, in “Till.”

results.title: ‘The Same Storm’ Review: A Lockdown Grab Bag
results.abstract: Featuring actors mainly performing from their own homes, this multistory drama clumsily wrestles with the struggles of everyday people during the first months of the pandemic.

multimedia.caption: Mary-Louise Parker in “The Same Storm,” directed by Peter Hedges.
Mary-Louise Parker in “The Same Storm,” directed by Peter Hedges.
Mary-Louise Parker in “The Same Storm,” directed by Peter Hedges.

results.title: ‘Rosaline’ Review: O Romeo, Romeo, Thank U, Next
results.abstract: Kaitlyn Dever plays Romeo’s snarky ex-lover in this Shakespeare reimagining, which crosses its source material with present-day sensibilities.

multimedia.caption: From left, Spencer Stevenson, Kaitlyn Dever, Kyle Allen and Henry Hunter Hall in “Rosaline.”
From left, Spencer Stevenson, Kaitlyn Dever, Kyle Allen and Henry Hunter Hall in “Rosaline.”
From left, Spencer Stevenson, Kaitlyn Dever, Kyle Allen and Henry Hunter Hall in “Rosaline.”

results.title: ‘Dark Glasses’ Review: She Wears Her Shades at Night
results.abstract: A prostitute blinded by a stalker tries to protect a young boy. But in his first film in 10 years, Dario Argento opts for visuals as banal as the scares.

multimedia.caption: Ilenia Pastorelli, left, and Asia Argento in a scene from “Dark Glasses.”
Ilenia Pastorelli, left, and Asia Argento in a scene from “Dark Glasses.”
Ilenia Pastorelli, left, and Asia Argento in a scene from “Dark Glasses.”

results.title: ‘Plan A’ Review: Seeking Vengeance for the Holocaust
results.abstract: Set in postwar Germany, this film dramatizes the true story of a group of Jewish survivors who sought revenge through an astonishing undercover operation.

multimedia.caption: August Diehl stars as a Holocaust survivor in postwar Germany in “Plan A.”
August Diehl stars as a Holocaust survivor in postwar Germany in “Plan A.”
August Diehl stars as a Holocaust survivor in postwar Germany in “Plan A.”

results.title: ‘Eternal Spring’ Review: When State TV Got Hijacked
results.abstract: Two decades after members of Falun Gong took over local television programming in Changchun, China, a documentary looks back.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “Eternal Spring,” an animated documentary film directed by Jason Loftus.
A scene from “Eternal Spring,” an animated documentary film directed by Jason Loftus.

results.title: ‘The Picture Taker’ Review: Civil Rights Photographer and F.B.I. Informant
results.abstract: The documentary, by the director of “Who Killed Malcolm X?,” is a compelling biography of Ernest Withers, whose photographs helped chronicle Black history.

multimedia.caption: A protester in 1960s Memphis. The documentary “The Picture Taker” offers a compelling biography of the photojournalist Ernest Withers.
